div.l: But now he was a thef outeragesly
For whiche the wardeyn chid and made fare
But ther of sette the Myller nought a tare
He Crakyd bost and swore hit nas nat soo
Thanne were there yone yone ȝunge pore clerkes too
That dwellyn dwellyn dweldyn in this hal whiche that I seie
Testif they were and lusty for to pleye
And only for hir myrth and reuerie
Vpon the wardeyn bisily they crie
To yiue hem leue bote a litil stounde
To gon to mylle and sen hir corne I grounde
And hardily thei durst leye hur nekke
The meller schulde nat stele hem a pekke
Of corne by sleyght ne be sighte hem reue
And att the laste the wardeyn yaf hem leue
Iohn hight that on and Aleyn hight that othir
Of on toune they were borne that hight strothir
For in the North I canne nat telle where
This Aleyn makith redy all his gere
And on an hors his sak he cast anon
Forthe goth Aleyn the Clerke and also Iohn
With gode swerde and bokeler girte by his side
Iohn knewe the wey hym nedid no gide
And at the mylle the sak a doun he leith
Aleyn spak first al haile Symounde he saith
How faris thi faire dought̉er and also thi wif
Aleyn wel com quoth Symkyn by my lif
And Iohn also how now what do ye here
Symound quoth Iohn by god nede hath no pere
He muste serue hym selfe that hath no swayn
Or els he is fole as Clerkis sayn
Sir oure maunsiple I hope he will be dede
So warkis ay the wangis in his hede
And ther for am I come and eke aleyn
To grynde oure corne and carie hit hom ageyn
I pray you sped ous hethen what ye may
Hit schall be done quoth Symkyn a non by my fay
What wolde ye done while hit is an honde
Bi god by the hopir right wole I stande
Quoth Iohn and se the corn how hit gos in
Yit saw I neuere by my fadir kynne
How that the hopir waggith to and fro
Aleyn answered and saide wilt thou soo
